caution.para: Suspension fasteners are critical parts because they affect performance of vital parts and systems and their failure can result in major service expense. A new part with the same part number must be installed if installation becomes necessary. Do not use a replacement part of lesser quality or substitute design. Torque values must be used as specified during reassembly to make sure of correct retention of these parts.

step1.para: Remove the front brake disc. For additional information, refer to Front Disc Brake in S04049.
Remove the ABS sensor bolt and ABS sensor harness bolt and position aside.
• To install, tighten to 11 Nm (8 Lbf-ft).
Using a suitable jack equipped with safety chains, support the front axle.
Remove both of the lower shock absorber nut, washers and bolts.
• To install, tighten to 353 Nm (260 Lbf-ft).
Remove the spindles. For additional information, refer to Wheel Spindle Removal.
Remove the stabilizer bar and link. For additional information, refer to Stabilizer Bar and Link.
Remove the U-bolt nuts, the U-bolts and the upper spring spacer plates.
• To install, tighten to 380 Nm (280 Lbf-ft).
Lower the jack and remove the axle assembly.
To install, reverse the removal procedure.
Check and, if necessary, align the front end. For additional information, refer to Suspension System - General Information.
